string_data:
PRIMARY: Eight Just Stop Oil activists were arrested at Gatwick Airport after seven entered the southern terminal at 8am, using suitcases with lock-on devices to block an entrance near a security gate. The protesters sat on the floor with their hands in lock-on devices, disrupting airport operations until being removed around 9:15am. They demanded swift political action on climate breakdown as part of the international "Oil Kills" campaign.

SECONDARY: The protest was part of a broader international campaign involving 21 groups across 12 countries demonstrating at 17 airports, following record-breaking global temperatures.

OTHER FOCAL: The article mentions two Just Stop Oil activists were recently found guilty of criminal damage for throwing soup over Van Gogh's Sunflowers painting at the National Gallery.

TONE: The article maintains a neutral, factual tone in reporting the protest events.
